title: Empathy-Based Experience Design for Remote Mathematics Learning During Digital Transformation

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and proficiency in online learning platform utilization
context.additional_context: Asynchronous mathematics education for working professionals, requiring a learning environment design that considers personal device utilization and social interaction

learning_goals: Learners enhance mathematical problem-solving skills by applying behavioral, cognitive, emotional, and social engagement strategies in remote environments.
Learners establish self-directed learning plans considering physical, technological, and social contexts using digital tools.
Learners analyze and share case studies of mathematical concept applications through asynchronous interactions with peers.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
